Cititel Mid Valley Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 14843 reviews

Stayed in Cititel Mid Valley about 8 years ago. This trip has the same feeling as last time. but I noticed the place is in need of a renovation.

Wall paper is pealing off, and toilet feels a little darker, etc... Friendly and helpful staff is always available. In my annual trips to Malaysia, I have been staying at the Boulevard, which is the opposite end of the mid valley shopping center. A little more high class than Cititel, but obviously, more expensive. $120 vs $80. Have same access to great shopping facilities, good food stales around, and pretty central and not a long distance to other major shopping areas. Only downside is taxi may be hard to find if you want to go out late at night. It's a good idea to grab the number of a good Blue Taxi driver who works around the area, or use UBER / Grab to catch a ride

Show more
Joseph , Australia
The Gardens - A St Giles Signature Hotel & Residences Kuala Lumpur
8.3 Excellent
Based on 7380 reviews

Stayed 2 nights with Gardens Residence and the stay was good. Total 6 of us including a 4 yo child. Ordered an extra bed which we put it at the master bedroom.

The bed side space is just nice to accommodate the extra bed and not really that easy to put down the extra bed. The master bathroom was very spacious and comes with a bathtub. If anti-slip mat are provided in the bathroom, a bonus point as we requested 2 anti-slip mats at around 9pm and it took quite a long while for us to receive them. Living room is good but the tv channels are not well received as compared to the rooms and this is something to be improved on. The staff are friendly. We did not ordered breakfast as the residences are connected to the Gardens Mall and Mid Valley Mall. Most eateries/ restaurants open at 7am on weekdays and 9am on weekends. Location was great as groceries supermarket at the mall are within few minutes of walk too. Overall, a nice stay with Gardens residences!

Show more
Kok , Singapore
One World Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5443 reviews

Book a junior suit and had excellent service at the check in at 19th floor (separate check in for suite) was given a suite on the 22nd floor and upon check in at suite was blown away by decor of suite.

After shower discover a big cockroach In the room. Use the VIP service to get someone to kill it and they use roach spray to solve the situation. Decided to change room as it smell of insecticide spray. Try the next room and discover a raw sewage smell , was given another room that was not made up yet! Was told by front desk employees this roach problems is a recurring situation but management decided not to do anything about it. Finally was given 2 rooms with connecting door and also discover baby roach and when ask the hotel employee to kill roach was told she also afraid of roach! When asked for housekeeping service was told housekeeping does not operate after midnight. Upon check out almost did not discover the extra charges that was wrongly billed. Will not recommend this hotel

Show more
Carol , United States
Furama Hotel Bukit Bintang
7.8 Very good
Based on 17301 reviews

Pros: 1. room clean; 2. aircond & hot shower working well; 3. wifi good & very stable; 4. staff with good manner; 5.

lounge food & environment is good; 6. breakfast taste good; 7. location consider good. Cons: 1. Check in process very slow. Need to wait for 20 mins when there is only 1 guest in front of me. Should open more counter if you noticed that many guests are paying at the counter; 2. lounge air cond at the dining area is hot. There is only cookies available during day time. Though food is good during cocktail session, you should add 1/2 snacks during day time. 3. Though the breakfast taste really good, the selection is limited. If stay more than 2 nights, it will be quite boring with the breakfast choice. 4. There was strong cigarette smell at my room corridor on the second day. You had specifically put up a notice to state that this is non-smoking hotel, you should make sure it is being strictly adhere to. The cleaning staff is there when the cigarette smell still exist. But she act like nothing happen rather than report to the respective team to find out who smoke and take necessary action.

Show more
Chun , Malaysia
Traders Hotel by Shangri-La
8.9 Excellent
Based on 9377 reviews

The 1st thing that caught our eye as we entered the room was the majestic view of the twin towers right in front of our eyes! Seemed close enough to touch.

Generally pleased with front desk staff who were able to see to my requests. Tracy checked us in when we came slightly early around 12+pm. With our room nt ready til 2pm, we waited at the lobby couches w our baby. We were surprised when Tracy came to us few minutes later informing that another room is ready for us and decided to alocate it to us since we had a baby w us. We were quite certain she forgot about us since more guests were beginning to crowd the front desk. Nice touch Tracy! Room was nice and shower facilities n water pressure was superb! Everything was working well except for small thing like the kettle. Tv channels were reasonably clear. Room and the AC felt clean enough. Improvement could be made to the babycot we requested. I found old biscuit crumbs under the mattress. And the cot was not working properly even after i requested for another one. The base could not be adjusted to higher height due to faulty or missing parts. Eventually ended up not using it. You should be aware that hygiene is priority for babies. And a lower base means having to bend down more to pick up the baby. Expected much better in this aspect. Overall would still recommend this place and room to others and would come back again! Thank you.

Show more
Benny , Singapore
Concorde Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7925 reviews

Booked few hours before check in. 1. From hotel car park quite a distance to walk to lobby as in another building with a linked walkway but carrying heavy luggage walking the staircase up and down.

.hhmmm...noticed there have Valet parking lot at the basement of hotel building. 2. Upon arrival at lobby, the front desk was congested with heavy load evening check-in. ( around 3 counters), a lady receptionist who just walked out from front office alerted and very attentive by immediately open another check in counter at my line. Firstly, she unable to find my booking provided name with I.D card, according to her reservation was closed on that day. Anyhow, i gave her the Agoda confirmation email of booking number and room details. Without further delay, she check me in and brief the rest of info as the routine procedure. (wifi login, breakfast...etc) when got into the room, later only found out that my room was upgraded from Superior to Deluxe.3. Room - Clean and quiet room with the basic facilities that meet 4-star standard plus ironing facilities and cd/dvd player. Comfort bed, good selection of international tv channel. WiFi connection a bit slow at night (barely connect) but speedy in the morning. No bathtub but shower with good water pressure, no water hose attached next to toilet bowl may be old structure of hotel building. Food - Good varieties of buffet dinner, A la carte for Combo set RM38nett not bad too, portion served just nice for a person. but was recommended the Chinese restaurant food not bad. Buffet breakfast meet the basic 3~4 star standard for Asean not Asian countries coz no Japanese or Korean in buffet line. Bakery choices are fair enough for the Western but not the cheeses and no dessert (mini tart or petit) so the finishing normally will be the fruits. Location - easy access to KLCC, Pavilion. Nearest place to chill out - Hard Rock Cafe just next to hotel. Overall a pleasant stay in Concorde Kuala Lumpur, recommended for business or leisure in KL

Show more
Chong , Malaysia
The Boulevard - A St Giles Hotel Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 6130 reviews

It was my second visit to stay at Studio. My thumbs up for praising one of your male staff, Mr Vasu at Executive Lounge whereby we went in for breakfast.

He was indeed cheerful, helpful and warm person. I was having a very bad cough with thick phlegm whilst in S'pore. Upon seeing my condition, he suggested that he will offer me warm lemon honey water. I stayed there for four days and three nights with my sister. Last day when my sister went down earlier for breakfast. Your kind staff, Mr Vasu was asking my sister how is my cough. Later I went down and was impressed of his memory of remembering our names. My last day he offered me warm honey lemon water. Sad to say that breakfast at 9th floor was no standard. I preferred to go up to Executive lounge and served by your smiling, courteous staff, Mr Vasu. I salute his caring and mannerism. It was indeed a warm environment and caring staff and I would indeed certainly recommend my friend, business associates & etc

Show more
Lum , Singapore
Dorsett Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 4931 reviews

The location is great because it is near to Bukit Bintang area. However, the Hotel doesn't deserve to be 5-star hotel.

The cleanliness is not great, and it is noticeable that they are inconsiderate about it. Another issue I faced is that when I checked out, I was surprised with additional tax that should be paid even though my reservation was inclusive of all taxes and fees. I tried to explain to the manager, but he doesn't care about my satisfaction, and he insisted that I should pay. I was in hurry because of my flight and the other thing is that they hold 300 deposit, so they take the money they want regardless my agreement. Shame on the management and there hotel.

Show more
Abdulaziz , Saudi Arabia
Berjaya Times Square Hotel, Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 6282 reviews

I booked this hotel expecting 5* service and facilities. I was late and my son attempted to check in at 3pm.

He was told to wait as the room was not avilable yet. He was not checked in until about 440pm. We were given a room in East wing. The room facilities were below par. When I arrived past 11pm, I realised the phone was not working properly- I was too tired to walk so far away to the West Wing concierge to complain. The towels were not sufficient - only 2 bath towels!! No face towels, no towels to dry the basin tops. No hand towels. The shower head was erratic. This is worse than some of the 2* hotels I have stayed in. I feel cheated as I have paid a premium price for 5* value. I could have booked the same type of room through Agoda at less than half the price. Last month I used this hotel and I was happy with it. I told the duty manager at check out and she told me some rooms in East wing also belong to hotel. In other words, there is no guarantee of 5*value for 5* price. That is a gamble I do not wish to take with Berjaya Hotel ever again. This is the last time I would use this hotel. There are so many other 5* hotel nearby this beautiful location.

Show more
Mei , Malaysia
The Majestic Hotel Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2750 reviews

Love the place. The staff were friendly and they try their best to assist though sometimes there are miscommunications but their sincerity wins over the mistakes.

I really like their spa as well... housed in a separate building nearer to the Majestic Wing. Although the hotel is not in the centre of the city, they have shuttle buses going to sentral-easy if you are taking the KLIA express train to and fro the hotel, to MidValley Mall which is one of the largest shopping mall in the country and Starhill which is an upmarket mall near the centre of the city. Aside from this there are few site seeing places within walking distance of the hotel. The only thing is the a la carte meals in the hotel are extremely pricy-a plate of char Kway Yeow at RM $ 60 /$70 (can't remember the exact price). However the dinner buffet at Contango is only $115 or so... hence actually I can't quite understand the huge price dfrence. I didn't opt for breakfast so can't comment on that.

Show more
Anna , Malaysia
PARKROYAL Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 6665 reviews

Stayed over for a night with my family. If you want a simple clean room that comes with a very strategic location with a spread for breakfast, this will be good for your choice.

Not advisable if you are paying for the services; nothing felt like a five-star service level. 1. Front desk: these are the first person to face hotel clients yet they barely made the cut in making the best impression with their conversational skills and they generally lack in attentiveness. Went to lower end and boutique hotels that have friendlier and better front desk services. From my personal experience; we, unfortunately, had to make a very late check in on a Saturday night so I may have caused inconveniences to the front desk POC. For some reason, it took longer than usual for the person to get the booking sorted out so when we casually asked "hey may i know why is this taking quite a while?", the receptionist curtly replied "I just came over to the front desk" and continued working. 2. Breakfast: the spread is somewhat decent; the first reason why I chose this place is primarily because I have read many positive reviews on this online. I have bigger issues with how they were managing the crowd and the level of attentiveness they have as a five-star establishment. I'm not sure if this was due to a major under-staff situation or the crowd management system just weren't efficient enough to handle the massive family crowds, but there was quite a hold-up with a queue and the receptionists seemed to be ticking off a messy sheet to count for attendance and gave a lukewarm response that doesn't give us any confirmation when asked whether we are ready to be seated. When asked again, the receptionist simply just gave us a look until we heard someone from afar calling us which then motioned us with a hand gesture to usher us to a table that they have just managed to clean. They should also start providing chairs for those in need (parents with kids, elderlies, pregnant ladies) at the counter

Show more
Sue , Malaysia
Shangri-La Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.9 Excellent
Based on 3836 reviews

We were very satisfied with everything with the exception of the Chinese restaurant, where the service was lousy and we had to wait for a simple "stirfried chicken dish" for 45 minutes.

During this waiting period, more than 12 of the personell circulated the table without doing anything not even when we asked about our food. The second complaint was the obliviation of cleaning glasses in the bathroom during the stay. All other parts of our stay was excellent with top marks for the lounge and all personell there.

Show more
Ulf , Sweden
Sunway Putra Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 8082 reviews

Thank you sunway hotel staff (reception solehah, laundry malay staff, club lounge staffs, chefs, etc) for your hospitality during my holiday 4d3n at club suite room.

Variety of foods offer.l during breakfast, lunch & dinner. Improvement need to look into: 1. No newspaper provided to the club suites.during my 4days staying there. 2. Housekeeping.not being properly done. The bathrobe provided only 1 unit during my first day check.in. 3. The trashbin in toilet should have the close lid since the kids below 5 years old maybe still using diapers and no close lid may derive a smelly area in toilet. 4. Providing the fragrance items to the bedroom or guest room area in club suite room. The fragrance smell nice at your lift area at level 34. Should be install at club suite room too ro even to other rooms. 5. Jacuzzi at pool area should provide the rules in front of the towel desk in order the staff not always keep going to jacuzzi asking parents not to let their kids going to jacuzzi.

Show more
Mohd , Malaysia
Tune Hotel klia2
7.5 Very good
Based on 8673 reviews

Great spot to stay if you have an early flight, just across the road from KLIA2 (otherwise you have to allow an hour from KL to the airport).

Follow the directions given by the hotel, the car park lift has different numbering of the levels to the terminal which is a little confusing but just go to level 3 in the lift as per directions. The bed was so comfortable! Otherwise it's a simple room with air con, tv, very small bathroom (but all that is needed for a shower), restaurant downstairs or food in the KLIA2 mall. Only complaint is the shower wasn't particularly clean... don't think the wall tiles had been cleaned in a long time, stains that I hope were just shampoo or soap caked on. Couldn't hear any planes but the sound of people talking in the corridors all night did carry through into the room which was a bit inconsiderate and annoying.

Show more
TERESA , Australia
Hilton Kuala Lumpur Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2634 reviews

Its Hilton! I have stayed in Hilton branded hotels in some other countries and I can say the rooms and services are immaculate.

I can really rely on their performance that my room won't be disappointing and it shall be up to what I would hope to get - all the time! KL Hilton has one of the nicest rooms in terms of layout, decoration and facility. The room sizes are generally big with exceptions of maybe a few on the middle floors (I think). I stayed here a number of times since January 2017 and got to experience different types of rooms and views. The room layout provides you a great sense of privacy with a "hallway" style entrance the sleeping area. The sleeping area comes complete with a movable study/dining table that you can move about and I always moved it close to the window for view and light. There is also a chaise-lounge by the window with plush pillows that you can laze in for a nice afternoon nap. The bed is also comfortable. the pillow that provide for you is seldom great but you can call "magic" for a change of pillow to suit your requirements. The shower and toilet and area is one of THE most generous and luxurious that I have come to experience in a hotel. The star of this area would be the deep and long, white marble clad bath tub! Superb! I love staying in this particular Hilton hotel and to date is my favorite among the other Hilton hotels!

Show more
Mohd , Malaysia
Empire Hotel Subang
7.7 Very good
Based on 4204 reviews

Location: Around 25mins from Subang Airport. The hotel itself is connected to Empire Shopping Mall which is quite convenient as you can get food and shopping easily without driving out.

Parking is free if you are hotel guest, just give your parking ticket to the front desk staff they will help you to waive off the parking fee. Check in: Just have to show front desk staff the hotel voucher and IC, no need to pay any deposit. Room: We stay in Premier Essential Room for 2 nights. The room is quite spacious, working desk area and the “bed room” are separated by the shower room. Love it as the shower area and toilet are separated by a glass, so the toilet bowl and floor won’t get wet easily when we take bath. Shampoo + shower gel, shower cap, towel and hair dryer are provided. Toothpaste and tooth brush are provided upon request. We requested for a King size bed, it is quite comfy and pillow are soft enough for us. Service: My washroom toilet got stuck on the 2nd day morning and I requested them to send someone up to fix it and they came up within 10mins and fix it for me. Front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff are quite friendly. Nothing much to complain.

Show more
Kah , Malaysia
The Everly Putrajaya Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 6501 reviews

1. The hot shower water pressure is always low. sometimes even no water at all but no problem with cold shower.

Plus the water temperature for the hot shower is not consistent. Be careful don't hurt yourself. 2. Room cleaning after housekeeping is not up to the standard of a four star hotel. Comforter with blood stain and on the floor (suspected the housekeeping staff injured himself during housekeeping, but he should changed a new comforter without his blood stain. He didnt take away the used towels on the floor, and only left one towel for us. 3. The safe box is not functioning. We have to bring everything with us when we were out from room. 4.Nobody serving at the swimming pool area. There are out of towels but we cant find someone to ask for a towel. And written there, must wear swimsuits to swim in the pool. However, i noticed many people just wear their normal ourfit because there is no guard to stop them. 5. Breakfast standard is only a 3 star hotel standard. However, the good sides are: 1. Hotel is walking distance from a simple shopping mall. Just next to the hotel. 2. There is swimming pool and gym room at the same floor. 3. The hotel manager is kind when we raised the room problem during housekeeping to her and she immediately ask her staff to go and check our room. Plus , she let us to check out late for free after she knew that me and my baby need to wait for my husband to come back from his meeting.

Show more
YEK , Malaysia
Sunway Resort Hotel & Spa
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3942 reviews

First thought I have when we checked in to our room, is that it's very old. And room is very small. We had been upgraded from premium park view room to a club room (also park view), as there is a mandatory power shut down on the day we checked in (Malaysia Boleh!).

So all guests were arranged to stay one night at the Hotel Pyramid next door (without having to move our luggage). But the moving here and there actually affects our sleep and made us more tired than we should be. The hotel kinda made this up by upgrading us to a Club room (without the use of the club lounge). But except the room is on a higher floor, really can't tell what's so special about the Club room. It's small. If fits 2 super single beds, and some basic furniture and that's all the space it has. Nothing to shout about and I would have preferred to continue to stay at the Hotel Pyramid (not given the option also) since it's just newly refurbished, at least the bed and toilet are new. Not only the furniture in the room is old, the facilities are also old, like the swimming pool. It's strange that swimming pool is almost always empty for the 3 days we were there. The quietest swimming pool we have seen so far. Could it be that there is the Sunway Lagoon next door or the pool is not attractive? The staff are worth giving 2 thumbs up. Service is good throughout - bell service, front door, front desk and breakfast buffet service staff. Buffet breakfast is good, with a wide variety of food and all look and taste pretty decent. Out of the 3 hotels, this is the most expensive hotels. But I felt it's really not worth the money. If you have to choose one, choose the other 2 which have been just gone through a major renovation recently. All 3 have easy access to the Sumway Pyramid shopping centre and Sunway Lagoon.

Me and my friends booked the quad room and we were placed in their new building, just behind their first building. Two shared bathrooms, one of them was a bit too small for a bathroom I guess. The quad room was ok. We had two bunkbeds which made quite a lot of sounds when someone moves. The air conditioner was a bit hot. They provided lockers in the room, an electric socket for each bed and also a pillow and blanket. All in all, we were satisfied with the price we paid. The location was great, especially when you want to travel with public transportation or need to go to the airport in the morning from KL Sentral. Facilities were ok, sufficient for basic needs. I think this place is suitable for young couples or groups who just need a place to sleep at night. Not really recommend it for family with young children or old parents. My girlfriend and I stayed at Orange Pekoe for 2 nights. The room was spacious and sparsely but tastefully furnished.

The bathroom was quite small and simple and there was only 2 power sockets in the room, both used up with lamps (the room can be qui're dim without them), so there's some difficulty if you need to charge your phone/ iPad/ camera/ NB in the room. The staff was quite hospitable and friendly, and helps with getting an adapter in a pleasant manner. However, on the second night of our stay, we returned to a room without any electricity- no AC, no hot water, no lights, just the stuffing air of KL. The staff explained that there's been some sort of power out for the neighborhood, but all around us the power was on Except our building. When asked if we can have a flashlight to pack (we have an early flight next morning), the staff only shrugged, saying they have candles if we want. In the end we laid in the dark till 5, in a suffocating room with generators humming loudly outside the room. The next morning the staff offered no apology, no explanation, no nothing, as if the whole incident never occurred. It was extremely disappointing to be treated like this, feeling like simply because we're getting a room on the cheap, we can expect no hospitality or care when shit hit the fan. Overall not a bad room if you don't want to spend much, but you can do so much better for just a little more.

Okay, admittedly, it took me 30 minutes to find the building, I guess it was partly my fault because I relied too much on Google Maps.

I typed "Summer Suites Bernice" and it pointed to me a different direction. The trick apparently is from Agoda (or any other booking website), you click "directions" and it will provide you a more accurate picture of the area. Also, better if you look for MERCU SUMMER SUITES which is the name of the building. Anyway, while I was a little bit pissed, the moment I met JAHA and saw how friendly he is and apologetic, the anger started to subside. And it evaporated completely when I saw the room!!! Imagine staying at the 28th floor of a condominium which is strategically located in an area that is very close to the city center. The view of course is amazing, I remember taking a peek at my room window and saw the KL tower! While you cannot see the Petronas Tower from the room (it is being blocked by another tall structure), it will take you less than 10 minutes by foot to the towers and the Kuala Lumpur City Center. Aside from the glorious view, Summer Suites Bernice has all the amenities - drinking water (both cold and hot and room temp), plates and mugs and utensils, fridge, even iron and hair dryer! Definitely an upgrade from the usual hostel! They maintain it very well so five stars as well for cleanliness. The dorm type also gives you an opportunity to meet and interact with people, as a solo traveler that is one major perk! Others might find it annoying to share a room with strangers, but I absolutely loved it - I even ended up hanging out with one of my room mates! The building is located in a safe area so I didn't mind going home at 2 or 4 in the morning after partying at Bukit Bintang. Haha. If ever I go back to KL, for sure I will stay again at Summer Suites Bernice - the best hostel in KL!

Ok, I booked this as an Agoda mystery 4 star hotel, so my review will be a little coloured by the fact that this is a serviced apartment - even though it is in the Crown Regency Hotel.

The positives - it's large, airy and very convenient. You have access to the pool, a well-equipped gym and the other services offered by the Crown Regency. So, if you're purchasing as a serviced apartment (rather than a mystery hotel) these things are all great. The negatives: cleanliness! Ok, so the property was cleaned but the mattress in the main bedroom had multiple blood stains and yellow stains and no mattress protector - so the stains showed through the very thin sheets. The sheets themselves (while undoubtedly cleaned) had multiple ingrained stains all over them and were very poor quality. The main bathroom really stank and the master ensuite was not much better. We left exhaust fans on and sprayed deodoriser but the smell would not budge. The dryer and washing machine filters required cleaning (and servicing according to the dryer readout). You do not have access to the front reception facilities (you need to make a time to meet someone at the property for check in and chec out) and you are only provided with 1 key to your room. This means that for a group of three we had nowhere to leave a key and had to juggle times to 'meet up' so we could all get back into the room after our different travels for the day. Lastly, until I booked I was unaware I had to provide a 500MR CASH deposit on the property. I've got no issue with room deposits but would have expected this to be undertaken by a Credit Card hold - rather than leaving me with 500MR on the last morning of my journey. In summary, great location and size, good wifi, a good serviced apartment but NOT a four star hotel (as advertised by Agoda) and standards of cleanliness and linen were poor.

More about Kuala Lumpur

Kuala Lumpur is the capital of Malaysia and the country's cultural and economic center. Most visitors to the city arrive through Kuala Lumpur International Airport, but the low cost carrier terminal known as Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2 is also a popular entry point for those flying with regional carriers. For those traveling through the city on their way somewhere else, there are plenty of hotels near both airports. However, if staying in Kuala Lumpur, there is plenty of accommodation in the city center as well.

Kuala Lumpur is a very modern city with an efficient and inexpensive public transportation system comprised of trains and light rail. The Petronas Towers are one of the most famous attractions in the city. The connecting bridge between the towers provides spectacular views of the city and taking tours to the sky bridge is a popular activity for tourists. Kuala Lumpur Tower also provides an observation deck featuring 360-degree unobstructed views of the city.

The 'Golden Triangle' section of the city comprises several large malls as shopping is a major attraction in Kuala Lumpur. The main shopping streets are Jalan Bukit Bintang, Jalan Sultan Ismail, and Jalan Imbi.

The city's China Town neighborhood provides a great opportunity to indulge in Chinese and Indian food as the restaurants are inexpensive, authentic, and plentiful. A modern city with a diverse and interesting population, Kuala Lumpur is definitely a place that must be explored.

There’s much more to see and learn about Kuala Lumpur, and the interactive map is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.

The pool was fantastic, really big with wading pools at either end. It was a large apartment for two friends travelling together. Wonderful view of KL, comfortable couch, beds and pillow. The aircon, fan and wifi worked very well. The bathroom contained a shower, bath and sink, and in a separate room there was the toilet, bidet and sink. The room was a little dated, and some minor repair work is needed for tiles in the bathroom. The kitchen tap dripped, which we could hear from the bedroom. The lighting in the room was a bit weird as there was no major light in the bedroom. There was also a strange smell in the bathroom, which would probably be solved by running the taps. The location, right above a mall, is extremely convenient and a recognisable landmark for taxi/grab drivers. Show more Amanda , Australia The Suitel 8.6 Excellent Based on 40 reviews The appartment had 3 rooms (2 upstairs rooms upstairs with one common Bathroom attached to both & 1 very small room down stairs. The bathroom downstairs was not attached to the room but just accross the corridor.). The sitting dinning and pantry section was spacious & lovely view of the city and hills in the horizon. It was equipped with cooking facilities, washing machine & large TV. Eventhough the appartment catered to 6 persons the cutlery & crockery was provided only for 4 persons. Good if additional cooking utencils & serving dishes could be provided as well cleaning cloth & a mop. Most probably the staff would have provided them or cleaned the appartment had I asked them. When I requested for a iron it was provided very promptly. A small issue in the toilet was immediately attended to by the maintenance staff. convenient store was available on the ground floor. Show more Harshini , Sri Lanka Golden Triangle Suites by Mondo 7.1 Very good Based on 382 reviews Pros : 1. Great location - very convenient, nearby to KLCC and Pavilion Cons : 1. I have requested to check in early the day before. Called them and they told me that there will be extra charges for early check in and asked me to email them the time for my check in so that they can tell me the extra rate they are charging. NO REPLY! Called them the next morning (on my check in day) and they insisted that NO EARLY CHECK-IN is allowed! We were there an hour earlier, they told us that they will arrange for us to check in but it turns out that WE WERE THERE FOR AN HOUR WAITING FOR NOTHING! NO EARLY CHECK IN IS POSSIBLE EVENTHOUGH I HAVE REQUESTED FOR SO MANY TIMES, EVENTHOUGH I AM WILLING TO PAY FOR THE EXTRA CHARGES! 2. They gave us the wrong room! Booked two one-bedroom suite but they ended up giving us only one one-bedroom suite and one normal bedroom as TOO many people checked in at the same time (everyone at 3pm) so the management got confused. We left after checking in, bumped into them at the lobby and asked them to switch the room for us. Two hours later, when we were back in the condo, to our surprise, our room was NOT changed!!! Called them and they asked us to change it by OURSELVES! HOW RIDICULOUS IS THIS? They offered to switch room with the other customer who mistakenly got our room without even cleaning it! HOW CAN YOU ASKED SOMEONE TO GO INTO A ROOM THAT HAS BEEN OCCUPIED BY ANOTHER CUSTOMER WITHOUT ANY HOUSEKEEPING BEFOREHAND?! 3. We requested for two single beds in one of our suite beforehand but was not informed that they are not available until we asked during check in. All in all, the management needs to improve their service! Show more Poh , Malaysia Private Studio Size Unit Suite at Sunway Resort Suite (Pyramid Tower) 7.4 Very good Based on 33 reviews The Penthouse KLCC 7.1 Very good Based on 26 reviews We booked the presidential penthouse suite that came with the balcony with a view overlooking the KL tower. We enjoyed staying at the penthouse very much, with most of the facilities in working order. We would have preferred to have a dish towel to dry the dishes after it is washed and perhaps a mop to help with keeping the bathrooms dry. Additional towels would have been great to have to dry off after getting out of the jacuzzi. Note that the tiles leading up to the balcony are quite slippery when wet. It was quite disturbing to find the electric kettle filled with slime/mold at the bottom thus rendering it unfit for use. There was a slight confusion during check in where I was given the wrong room despite me very clearly mentioning my full name upon check in. The staff was initially adamant that no mistake was done and it was I who made the wrong booking. It was only after I showed him a private message I left on facebook with the management that he was willing to double check and apologise for having made a mistake. No harm done but as an aside would recommend the management to perhaps make the names of the units less confusing for guest and staff alike. FYI parking is RM10 per entry. Show more Mei , Malaysia Placin @ Crown Regency KL 8.3 Excellent Based on 115 reviews Ok, I booked this as an Agoda mystery 4 star hotel, so my review will be a little coloured by the fact that this is a serviced apartment - even though it is in the Crown Regency Hotel. The positives - it's large, airy and very convenient. You have access to the pool, a well-equipped gym and the other services offered by the Crown Regency. So, if you're purchasing as a serviced apartment (rather than a mystery hotel) these things are all great. The negatives: cleanliness! Ok, so the property was cleaned but the mattress in the main bedroom had multiple blood stains and yellow stains and no mattress protector - so the stains showed through the very thin sheets. The sheets themselves (while undoubtedly cleaned) had multiple ingrained stains all over them and were very poor quality. The main bathroom really stank and the master ensuite was not much better. We left exhaust fans on and sprayed deodoriser but the smell would not budge. The dryer and washing machine filters required cleaning (and servicing according to the dryer readout). You do not have access to the front reception facilities (you need to make a time to meet someone at the property for check in and chec out) and you are only provided with 1 key to your room. This means that for a group of three we had nowhere to leave a key and had to juggle times to 'meet up' so we could all get back into the room after our different travels for the day. Lastly, until I booked I was unaware I had to provide a 500MR CASH deposit on the property. I've got no issue with room deposits but would have expected this to be undertaken by a Credit Card hold - rather than leaving me with 500MR on the last morning of my journey. In summary, great location and size, good wifi, a good serviced apartment but NOT a four star hotel (as advertised by Agoda) and standards of cleanliness and linen were poor. Show more Sharon , Australia S Suites @ The Scott Garden 7.9 Very good Based on 150 reviews Similar to air bnb, NOT a service apartment. Checking in was really troublesome. 1) If you are driving, DO not head directly to the soho carpark. 2) Need to call someone to pick the keys. Good to note the no. to call. I had a hard time getting a stable network to download the PDF from my email. 3) Only towels, shampoo and soap are provided. Snacks or water in the home are chargeable. Though it mentions hair dryer and tv... it was not working.... tv was basically like watching pixels or **** 4) Walls are so thin i could hear the neighbours early in the morning and late at night. If you are looking for places to drink, this accommodation will fit you. otherwise beside tesco, nothing much is around. Will not stay again. Rather pay a bit more to get way better experience. Show more Shin , Singapore The Best KLCC View @ Regalia Residences 8.6 Excellent Based on 132 reviews some issue about the securities guard over there, they even could not understand "english or bahasa malaysia" because they are foreigner and the parking system really make me mad, they does not issue a access card to guest and every time we go in and out, we need to go at the lobby (lvl 4) to register our car plate number over and over again~ after register they just give us the simple manila card with printing (visitor parking)~ after park in and we need to go out, they take back the card and when i come back, they not allowed me to park in again! and they ask us go registered the car plate number again at the lobby and we need to go to the lobby again! is really annoying~ they already gave my car record why i have to register again! and get scold by the securities guard (masuk keluar masuk keluar!) really make me sad~ jia , Malaysia Regalia Residence @ Holiday Home 8.1 Excellent Based on 156 reviews If you are gonna go there by foot, you need to go through a very steep stairs with all your baggages. You need to hire a taxi if you want to be dropped at the front of the hotel. The staff, mostly indians, are really lazy and are not willing to help. They wont help you get a cab, and are not even willing to help us contact the home owner of the unit we are renting. They just said sorry and that is it. It seems like they do not care about their guests. The hotel and the facilities itself is nice but i would rather have a modest hotel with very helpful staff. Especially since most of the people there cannot speak good english. Their english is really really bad. It is not tourist friendly. I suggest you take the suncity hotel, which is also near the area. On the day of check in, i was told to pay security deposit RM600 but unfortunately due to i was not being informed earlier, i have not much cash with me just around RM150 that time. I trying to bargain with the PIC Alex that my friend is OTW and he can make full payment upon his arrival. I was being rejected and he even replied me that even the access card itself is more expensive than what i have on hand. This is definitely offending me to the max. Furthermore he says that the deposit requirements is stated on Agoda website, too bad I couldn't find it and he says will come back to me with proof but he also failed it! Upon check out also late with bad attitude too. This is worse experience i ever had with Agoda booking. Hope Agoda will look into this problem and revert me. TQVM. Show more ZHE , Malaysia NS Golden Green Serviced Suite @ Times Square 6.9 Good Based on 289 reviews Our stay was nice. The rooms are a fantastic size for families, but really need to be refurbished. The view was beautiful I must say! I sent a MSG to hotel via Agoda advising on time of arrival so our check in would be smooth. It was smooth and check out was good, they allowed us to leave our baggage in their office as we had a late flight. The shopping centre doesn't open until 10 so if you want to eat breakfast you need to go elsewhere. We travelled with friends and we were given different floors, we were not told that we could only access our own floor. I hsd no wifi in the room and no phone made it difficult to communicate, I tried stairwell, but they have no inside handles. We ended up swapping spare cards. Please note: be careful walking on the streets, I have been very complacent and unfortunately after catching monorail to Bukit Nanas and walking to Petronas around Midday an unregistered motorbike drove on the inside of footpath and reached out and grabbed at my dress, I think he tried to grab my necklace, but in doing so he broke the strap of my dress and luckily my necklace was still intact. My kids were shaken up. We reported to a passing police car. So please be mindful! Show more Leanne , Australia The Ohana Suite 8.3 Excellent Based on 449 reviews we stayed on the 3A floor. travelled with a group of 5 of us and the staff was nice to arrange so that we all could stay in the same place (of course subject to avaliability) we more that what we expected. we had the toilet and even the kitchen to ourselves. each bed has a personal cabinet and power socket, also with an additional cupboard with a latch to lock. remember to bring locks if you are travelling, they sell locks too. do note that this is a hostel and not a hotel so you can't expect hotel level service. but cleanliness and all those are really sufficient. the main reception is at 25th storey, u can see the sign when u come out of the lift. really cozy place to chill. there's a desktop for you to use as well. if you can't find the hostel, find Furama Hotel. it is right beside. tell the taxi driver to go there if you dont know the address. the hostel is located in the building "TARAGON" which is like an apartment with residence in it. security is not too bad, just tell them u're gg Ohana hostel or smth they'll let you in as u need the hostel key to enter/exit your own door and the door of the building. overall, its a relatively new hostel exceeds my expectations. there's swimming and gym facilities for use as well. Show more Marian , Singapore KL Times Suite @ Times Square 8.2 Excellent Based on 347 reviews First, let me say that the value for money was EXCELLENT because the apartment was on the 40th floor, had a kitchenette, and everything (except for an unneeded tape deck) worked perfectly. However, I feel it was misrepresented as there was no phone and therefore no option for room service, laundry, etc. as stated in the Agoda.com ad. I had a wonderful time and recommend these suites to all because the aforementioned was acceptable to me for the price I paid and the view and facilities I had access too. However, if you enjoy Lobby service, (I had to enter through the East tower and walk through the mall with my luggage to the West tower), access to a phone and other hotel staples, be aware of what you are getting. If you don't care about those things then the location view and access to all hotel facilities is definitely worth the money! Luckily, they provided us free WiFi, the WiFi connection is very strong. I am very satisfied on it. Back to the topic, when we walked into the room, the room look okay, but from the room decoration, we can know that, they did not try their best in maintenance the room to make it look more nice but it is just a very minor part. So, it is acceptable as the building was 5 yo or above (if i not mistaken is completed in 2011). Second, i would like say a million thanks to Mr. Yeasin as he is very kind and helpful, although sometimes we having some communication problems but he is still trying his best to help us to solve the problems. Example, we check-in at 2pm, after he brought us to the room, and we put our luggage and we left without closing all the air-con (i know it is not Eco-friendly, but the air-con is really not cold when we just open). We came back at 10pm, all the air-con in the rooms are still the same, only have wind but not cold at all, only the living room is function as usual. We called him at 10pm something and he came and check for us very patiently. After he also have no idea on what happening on the air-con, he call the technician to check for us. We really appreciate for what he did for us. Third, before we depart to Kuala Lumpur, i had called him for several times to ask about the location, hotel policy and so on as they are different management with Swiss-Garden Residence. He gave me a lot of information which are very useful. Example, he taught us how to come to the residence by using monorail from KL Sentral and so on. Conclusion, i would like to said it is a very excellent services. Mr. Yeasin is a very helpful, kindness and patient guy who will Show more Chin , Malaysia Summer Suites Studios 8.4 Excellent Based on 125 reviews Spent 5 days at the accommodation. It did feel a little seedy in the evenings. It's a bit of a concrete jungle in there. Not a lot of soul. The process of 'self check-in' is a bit confusing. Kuala Lumpur 5 Capsule Hotels in Kuala Lumpur 4 More about Kuala Lumpur Kuala Lumpur is the capital of Malaysia and the country's cultural and economic center. Most visitors to the city arrive through Kuala Lumpur International Airport, but the low cost carrier terminal known as Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2 is also a popular entry point for those flying with regional carriers. For those traveling through the city on their way somewhere else, there are plenty of hotels near both airports. However, if staying in Kuala Lumpur, there is plenty of accommodation in the city center as well. Kuala Lumpur is a very modern city with an efficient and inexpensive public transportation system comprised of trains and light rail. The Petronas Towers are one of the most famous attractions in the city. The connecting bridge between the towers provides spectacular views of the city and taking tours to the sky bridge is a popular activity for tourists. Kuala Lumpur Tower also provides an observation deck featuring 360-degree unobstructed views of the city. The 'Golden Triangle' section of the city comprises several large malls as shopping is a major attraction in Kuala Lumpur. The main shopping streets are Jalan Bukit Bintang, Jalan Sultan Ismail, and Jalan Imbi. The city's China Town neighborhood provides a great opportunity to indulge in Chinese and Indian food as the restaurants are inexpensive, authentic, and plentiful. A modern city with a diverse and interesting population, Kuala Lumpur is definitely a place that must be explored. There’s much more to see and learn about Kuala Lumpur, and the interactive map is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.
